channel.title: CVE Feed for Bosch -- CPP Firmware
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Bosch -- CPP Firmware

item.title: CVE-2021-23847|2024-08-03T19:14:09.274Z -- bosch -- cpp%20firmware
item.description: A Missing Authentication in Critical Function in Bosch IP cameras allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to extract sensitive information or change settings of the camera by sending crafted requests to the device. Only devices of the CPP6, CPP7 and CPP7.3 family with firmware 7.70, 7.72, and 7.80 prior to B128 are affected by this vulnerability. Versions 7.62 or lower and INTEOX cameras are not affected.

item.title: CVE-2021-23851|2024-08-03T19:14:09.460Z -- bosch -- cpp%20firmware
item.description: A specially crafted TCP/IP packet may cause the camera recovery image web interface to crash. It may also cause a buffer overflow which could enable remote code execution. The recovery image can only be booted with administrative rights or with physical access to the camera and allows the upload of a new firmware in case of a damaged firmware.

item.title: CVE-2021-23850|2024-08-03T19:14:09.385Z -- bosch -- cpp%20firmware
item.description: A specially crafted TCP/IP packet may cause a camera recovery image telnet interface to crash. It may also cause a buffer overflow which could enable remote code execution. The recovery image can only be booted with administrative rights or with physical access to the camera and allows the upload of a new firmware in case of a damaged firmware.

item.title: CVE-2021-23854|2024-08-03T19:14:09.247Z -- bosch -- cpp%20firmware
item.description: An error in the handling of a page parameter in Bosch IP cameras may lead to a reflected cross site scripting (XSS) in the web-based interface. This issue only affects versions 7.7x and 7.6x. All other versions are not affected.

item.title: CVE-2021-23853|2024-08-03T19:14:09.733Z -- bosch -- cpp%20firmware
item.description: In Bosch IP cameras, improper validation of the HTTP header allows an attacker to inject arbitrary HTTP headers through crafted URLs.

item.title: CVE-2021-23852|2024-08-03T19:14:09.365Z -- bosch -- cpp%20firmware
item.description: An authenticated attacker with administrator rights Bosch IP cameras can call an URL with an invalid parameter that causes the camera to become unresponsive for a few seconds and cause a Denial of Service (DoS).

item.title: CVE-2021-23849|2024-08-03T19:14:09.380Z -- bosch -- cpp%20firmware
item.description: A vulnerability in the web-based interface allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to trigger actions on an affected system on behalf of another user (CSRF - Cross Site Request Forgery). This requires the victim to be tricked into clicking a malicious link or opening a malicious website while being logged in into the camera.

item.title: CVE-2021-23848|2024-08-03T19:14:09.760Z -- bosch -- cpp%20firmware
item.description: An error in the URL handler Bosch IP cameras may lead to a reflected cross site scripting (XSS) in the web-based interface. An attacker with knowledge of the camera address can send a crafted link to a user, which will execute javascript code in the context of the user.
